cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to cross south Florida overnight, enter the southeastern Gulf Saturday, then track northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Mississippi) Monday–Tuesday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, Florida (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Florida Panhandle, greatest risk Louisiana–Mississippi shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible Monday with a 26 % cumulative chance; low (6 %) chance of 58 mph gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of at least 3–5 ft possible along Plaquemines Parish coastline and lower Mississippi River as the system approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow-moving system could bring 4–8 in of rain with locally higher amounts Monday–Tuesday, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and brief navigation restrictions from rough seas and river backing.
